item.title: Help! a bit too wierd! (for a newb like me)
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“jake folmer, post:9, topic:61822”]im not in the mood i start reading two chapters and already bored the shit out of my self… ALL I NEED TO KNOW IS WHAT A STRING IS???[/quote]a String is a sequence of char’s a char is a single character like ‘a’ to be example.

A String in Java is surrounded by quotes these -> "
So all lines in Java with "s around them are Strings.

Honestly, that is like the basics of the basic, if you cba to learn that, then you shouldn’t even be TRYING to make a server

Read full topic

item.title: Help! a bit too wierd! (for a newb like me)
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

If you don’t know ANY java (i’m assuming you don’t because well…you don’t know what a string is…) then go to www.moparisthebest.com/java and read over some of that, learn java, THEN come back

everything will make sooo much more sense, I SWEAR

item.title: Help! a bit too wierd! (for a newb like me)
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

Probably a good idea yeah, like he said to review and get to know the basics of java. Alot of people seem to wander in here wanting a prepackaged .exe file that self extracts and runs the server along with the client, with updates that of runescape. Doesn’t work like that. I’m sure it could but doesn’t. The assumed knowledge when you down a source and client is that you going to know what you’re doing.

Read full topic
